title: Newly Opened - Part Time Merchandiser - Monroe, NY
description:
American Greetings is a global leader in the Celebrations marketplace.
  

Celebrate with us and join our team today!  

  

As a Merchandiser with American Greetings, you are a vital part of our company’s purpose: helping people celebrate holidays, each other, and all of life’s special moments, by making the world a more thoughtful and caring place every single day. We are looking for merchandisers to service the American Greetings Department in retail locations.  

  

* The starting pay is $15.30 per hour with two increases during the first year of employment (the listed rates are subject to change based on work location).
* After 6 months of employment the pay rate will increase to $16.20.
* After 1 year of continued employment the pay rate will increase to $17.00.
* We offer flexible work scheduling.
* We provide paid training.

  

This route will service the following retail locations: Target, 128 Bailey Farm Rd, Monroe, NY, 10950; Five Below, 128 Bailey Farm Rd, Suite 107A; Dollar General, 2 Lakes Rd; West Point Exp 1044317, 1202 Stoney Lonesome Rd., West Point, NY and Usma Px - 1044343, Bldg 1204 - Attn: Manager, West Point, NY.  

  

The weekly average hours are 9 hours per week. The weekly hours may increase to an average of 21 hours per week around holidays.
  

  

Primary Responsibilities:
  

  

* Merchandise and maintain all product displays within the greeting card department as well as other areas of the store as needed.
* Work in a fast paced retail environment utilizing your effective time management skills.
* Partner and build relationships with retail store associates and management during daytime retail business hours.
* Use a company provided tablet to perform basic job functions, such as reviewing weekly service and tasks, inventory functions, time entry, etc.
* Ability to speak, read, write, and understand English is required.

**Experience Required:**


No Experience Necessary! We will train you!  

  

Qualifications:
  

* 18 years or older
* Ability to lift up to 40 pounds with or without reasonable accommodation
* Access to reliable transportation as most routes have multiple retail locations
* Access to reliable internet to receive critical job information and updates
* Meet scheduling needs - Occasional weekends, the day before and after major holidays as needed (e.g., Valentine's Day, Easter, Mother's Day, Father's Day, Halloween, Thanksgiving, and Christmas)

  

American Greetings priority is the health safety of all our employees, and we are taking extra precautions to make sure all associates follow all federal, state, and local safety guidelines.
  

  

This company is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, gender, disability or protected veteran status. EOE M/F/disability/vet VEVRAA Federal Contractor.
  

  

Related Backgrounds & Industries: Retail, Customer Service, Merchandising, Part-time, Merchandiser, Stocker, #merchandiser
**Career Site Category**


Part-Time Merchandiser Jobs
company_description: American Greetings is a creator and manufacturer of products that assist consumers in making the world a more thoughtful and caring place.

title: Billing Associate
description:
*Your privacy is important to us. All applications are strictly confidential.*

**Refuah Health**is a federally qualified health center offering comprehensive care in Rockland and Sullivan Counties. We are over one hundred healthcare professionals strong with three decades experience providing unparalleled patient care. As an FQHC, we specialize in accessible and affordable care for low income and high-risk residents. We believe in the power of people to create great care and we are inviting the best to build their career with us!

**Why Refuah?**

* Join a collegial team of coworkers.
* Five modern state of the art facilities.
* Flexible schedules for maximum work-life balance.
* No experience required. Full training provided.


The Billing Associate is responsible for the day to day billing process that includes insurance verification, prior authorizations, data entry, billing of various insurances and follow up on accounts.

**Duties and responsibilities:**

* Assists the receptionist in verifying insurances and charging self pay patients.
* Runs open item reports, corrects claim and re-bills claim.
* Maintains confidentiality of patient information at all times.
* Complies with applicable policies and procedures and supports the Compliance Program.
* Contributes to organizational operations by performing other duties as may be required.
* High School Diploma or GED.
* Adherence to laws and confidentiality guidelines
* Proven experience as billing clerk or general accounting experience (preferred)
* Excellent communication skills
* Proficient in MS Office (especially Excel) working knowledge of relevant software will be appreciated
* Ability to establish and maintain courteous and professional relationship with staff, patient and others.

**Apply Today:**


If you are looking to make a positive impact, we invite you to apply. Join Refuah in transforming the healthcare experience. Apply now to be a part of our dynamic team.

**Principals only. Recruiters, please do not contact us regarding this job.**

title: DSP (Direct Support Professional) 6 hours total. After 4:30pm during week. HAVERSTRAW, NY. $22-25
description:
**Looking to hire a DSP that is available after school hours- 6 hours total per week- after 4:30pm.** 

Seeking an experienced support professional who has chosen this field because they are committed to making a positive difference in the lives of people with developmental disabilities through a career in health or mental care.

You have at least a high school degree with experience in direct and active support of people with autism, down's syndrome, etc. or even better, a bachelor's degree in a field related to health and mental care: psychology, special education, mental health, behavioral science, etc. We offer competitive pay and benefits in a fast-growing, start-up-like environment where the right combination of independent, creative thinking and enthusiastic teamwork will guarantee career growth.

You will be responsible for supporting our program participant.

**Provide Safety & Support**

* Ensure health, safety and welfare of client with developmental disabilities.
* Safeguard and respect the confidentiality of the individual and their family.
* Promote individual's independence.
* Assist to develop and maintain relationships.
* Promote and protect the health, safety and emotional well-being of the client.
* Commit to person-centered supports and honor the personality, preferences, culture and strengths of the client.
* Work in partnership with client to support to lead self-directed lives.
* Implement and adhere to established actionable plans.
* Ability to communicate effectively.
* Be able to establish rapport and communicate positively with parents.
* Provide information to parents about behaviors and interactions with the child.

**Administrative & Company Policies**

* Commitment to company values and adherence to policies.
* Uphold the standards set by the National Alliance for Direct Support Professionals (NADSP) Code of Ethics.
* Be familiar with fire evacuation and emergency procedures within the home and community environments.
* Maintain all required certifications.
* May be required to report to alternate work location (job-coaching can take place anywhere in the community, within 10 miles)
* Report problems and concerns to supervisors immediately
* Perform other duties as assigned by supervisors and/or senior management

**Education/Qualifications**

* High school diploma required, bachelors or masters preferred.
* Experience working with medically fragile people and with people with intellectual/developmental disabilities.
* Valid driver’s license and impeccable driving record.
* Willingness to provide personal care.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $22.00 - $25.00 per hour

Expected hours: 6 per week

Application Question(s):

* Are you available to work 6 hours total a week after 4:30pm in Haverstraw, NY? What is your availability?

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Special needs caregiving: 1 year (Preferred)

Language:

* any other language (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Driver's License (Required)
* CPR Certification (Preferred)

Work Location: In person

title: Real Estate Agent- High commission splits!
description:
Growing real estate firm of 600 agents is seeking Real Estate Agents who will advise clients on every facet of the real estate sales and purchasing process. This person will help to partner with, and guide clients through the real estate purchase process. Our client is seeking dynamic and motivated Real Estate Agents to join its team in providing clients with the best possible real estate transaction experience.

Firm offers industry leading high split commission options and comprehensive resources to help you become and maintain success.

You must be a self-starter who thrives working independently. Must be thorough, dependable, and detail-oriented. You will have control over your own schedule.

Can work Greater New York Metro, NJ, or Conn.

Job Responsibilities

* Assist clients in preparing their home to put on the market
* Creatively devise marketing strategies to ensure a prompt and profitable home sale
* Aid clients in the home search process by taking them to home showings and open houses
* Mediate during sales and purchasing negotiations to advocate for clients best interests
* Become an expert in the local real estate market and stay informed on recent home sales
* Develop marketing materials to advertise your Real Estate Agent services
* Pursue career development training to keep yourself informed and an expert in your field

This is a rising firm that will offer competitive commission rates, create a supportive and encouraging work environment to help you be successful. You will have the flexibility to set your own schedule so you can have a work-life balance.

PAYMENT WITHIN 48 HOURS OF DEAL CLOSING  
Must have a Real Estate license before hire.

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $135,059.00 per year

Experience:

* Sales: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* New York Real Estate License (Preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Melville, NY 11747
company_addresses:
5 West 37th Street
12th Floor
New York NY 10038
company_description: We are a brokerage built by agents, for agents. Oxford is home to over 800 amazing agents who have a high split and receive high service.

title: Commercial Real Estate Agent- High Commission Splits!
description:
A great opportunity has arisen with Oxford Property Group for experienced and ambitious Commercial Real Estate Agents with a proven track record in commercial real estate. As a Commercial Real Estate Agent at Oxford Property Group, you will be a part of a talented and driven team that thrives on working in a fast-paced environment and using initiative to create opportunities. We are seeking a natural relationship-builder to form close working relationships and deliver the highest standards of service to clients. We have some of the highest splits in the business!  
Objectives of this Role

* Be responsible for the end-to-end management of deals for the sale of commercial properties, ensuring a positive client experience
* Act as the main point of contact between property owners and prospective buyers to ensure a fair dealing for all parties
* Assist landlords in promoting their properties for sale, and offer advice to interested buyers
* Negotiate and prepare relevant paperwork (contracts, deeds, leases, etc.) prior to the sale of a commercial property
* Perform comparative market analysis to accurately value commercial properties
* Conduct research on the local market and stay up-to-date on industry trends

Skills and Qualifications

* A self-motivated and ambitious real estate professional
* Well-developed communication and relationship-building skills
* Excellent multitasker and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment
* A high level of personal responsibility, honesty, and empathy
* Goal-oriented with a focus on personal development
* Ability to bounce back from rejection, and solve problems creatively
* Good knowledge of the local property market

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $48,326.94 - $195,201.01 per year

Experience:

* Real estate: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Real Estate License (Preferred)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Melville, NY 11747

5 West 37th Street
12th Floor
New York NY 10038

title: Crew Member
description:
JERSEY MIKE'S SUBS has been making amazing subs since 1956 in Point Pleasant New Jersey!

  

The Jersey Mikes tradition was founded on a strong sense of community and commitment to the personal and professional development of our people. Our goal is to serve the highest quality sub sandwich to our customer in a manner that projects a thankful and caring mentality to every person that comes through our door. Our culture is a culture of "giving" and supporting our local communities so that all can be lifted together.

  

"Jersey Mike's "A Sub Above"

  

Jersey Mike's Subs is looking for Crew Members for its fast casual restaurants.

  

Become part of Jersey Mike's vibrant organization! Grab hold of our powerful positive energy with a Jersey Mikes ready-to-take-off career that is fun, fulfilling and rewarding!

  

If you like to have fun, banter with people and enjoy sharing your life then working at Jersey Mike’s may be for you. Besides learning our business and pleasing people with our great authentic sub sandwiches, you'll learn a whole new level of social decorum to take through life.

  

So become part of our tradition! Jersey Mike's was built on a strong sense of community and an outstanding commitment to the personal growth of our people. If you enjoy being part of something special in a strong cultural and spirited environment then bring your energy and come grow with us!

  

The primary requirement of a Jersey Mike’s employee is commitment to company goals:

* Create food consistent with Jersey Mike’s high quality standards
* Maintain restaurant that is noticeably cleaner than others
* Work in a fast paced team driven atmosphere
* Ability to multitask and work with a sense of urgency
* Interface with customers and provide an exceptional experience
* Full understanding of the terms accountability and information

  

Key Competencies:

* Excellent Menu and product knowledge awesome personality
* Must be able to thrive in a fast pace environment
* Desire to improve self and skill sets
* Able to communicate effectively with guests. Awesome personality
* Participate in all Jersey Mike's training programs
* Ability to meet schedule requirements and is a reliable performer


Other

* We commonly hire people that have also applied at McDonald's and Trader Joes and other restaurant, crew member and team member positions.
* Earn tips along with your base pay
* Get paid sick leave
* Get free meals when working
  

This website is not operated by Jersey Mike’s Franchise Systems. Jersey Mike’s restaurants are independently owned and operated franchise locations. Franchisees are independent business owners who set their own wage and benefit programs, which can vary between franchisees. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the franchisee.


INDQS

title: Entrepreneurial Real Estate Agents and Brokers
description:
Seeking agents with true entrepreneurial spirit!

Growing real estate firm is interested in speaking with successful Brokers and agents who may be interested in more flexibility and autonomy.

This is a high-commission brokerage suited for the entrepreneurial spirit. The firm offers industry-leading high-split commission options and comprehensive resources to help you become and maintain success.

You must be a self-starter who thrives working independently. Must be thorough, dependable, and detail-oriented. You will have control over your own schedule.

This is a brokerage created by agents, for agents here to redefine the industry by empowering you to do business on your own terms. The firm offers the same amenities you'd expect from traditional brokerages: signs, office space, printers, a plethora of training classes, and more. On top of that, provide unlimited graphic design for your collateral needs, including show sheets, pitch decks, mailers, and more. But here's the key distinction: We believe in allowing each agent to conduct business in the way that suits them best.

ALL INQUIRIES WILL REMAIN CONFIDENTIAL

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $39,990.18 - $215,898.28 per year

Schedule:

* Choose your own hours

Experience:

* Sales: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* New York Real Estate License (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10011

title: Bartender
description:
Hungry for Hospitality?
  
  

FIRE UP YOUR CAREER! Anthony’s Coal Fired Pizza has the FRESHEST ingredients any way you slice it! When you put good things in the Oven, good things come out. Everything served HOT, HOT, HOT, including our signature pizzas that are cooked in a 900-degree Oven. You're the last piece of the pie! People are our greatest ingredient for success and the most important part of who we are! At Anthony’s, you’ll be a part of an exciting, passionate, and dedicated team with growth opportunities. We have a strong commitment to our team’s personal and professional success, so we offer highly competitive compensation and great benefits:
  
  

**Salary:** $5.26 - $6.50 per hour Plus Tip
  
  

BARTENDER
  
* Flexible Work Schedules
* Career Growth Opportunities
* Benefits for eligible team members
* Referral Bonus
* Hands-on training programs for Menu and Beverage knowledge


Bartender is generally offered as a part time restaurant job.
  
  

Prior experience Bartender, bar back, barback, server, servers, waiter, waiters, wait staff or other part time FOH restaurant jobs highly desirable.
  
  

Prior experience is highly desirable in one of the following roles and brands: Bartender, bar back, barback, server, servers, waiter, waiters, wait staff or other part time FOH restaurant jobs at Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza, Yard House, Tap 42, Lazy Dog, Cheesecake Factory, TGI Fridays, Longhorn, True Food Kitchen, Maggiano's.
  
  

Requirements/Responsibilities
  
Bartender Requirements/Responsibilities
  
* Previous bartending experience preferred
* Be a hospitality champion by having awareness in the dining room and upholding ACFP standards
* Embraces the ACFP menu in order to answer guests’ questions and suggestively sell
* Create craft cocktails
* Have knowledge of alcoholic service laws and standards
* Be of legal age to serve alcohol based on state mandated guidelines
* Build a rapport with our guests
* Work in a standing position throughout their shift
* Maintain a great attitude and smile throughout their shift
* Operate a point-of-sale system
* Safely lift up to 30 pounds
* Passionate quality food safety, quality standards & sparkly clean restaurant


Prior experience Bartender, bar back, barback, server, servers, waiter, waiters, wait staff or other part time FOH restaurant jobs highly desirable.
  
  

Prior experience is highly desirable in one of the following roles and brands: Bartender, bar back, barback, server, servers, waiter, waiters, wait staff or other part time FOH restaurant jobs at Anthony's Coal Fired Pizza, Yard House, Tap 42, Lazy Dog, Cheesecake Factory, TGI Fridays, Longhorn, True Food Kitchen, Maggiano's.

Please do not send any emails, resumes, or call.
  
We are making it really easy to apply for this position.

title: Commercial Real Estate Agent
description:
A great opportunity has arisen with Oxford Property Group for experienced and ambitious Commercial Real Estate Agents with a proven track record in commercial real estate. As a Commercial Real Estate Agent at Oxford Property Group, you will be a part of a talented and driven team that thrives on working in a fast-paced environment and using initiative to create opportunities. We are seeking a natural relationship-builder to form close working relationships and deliver the highest standards of service to clients. We have some of the highest splits in the business!  
Objectives of this Role

* Be responsible for the end-to-end management of deals for the sale of commercial properties, ensuring a positive client experience
* Act as the main point of contact between property owners and prospective buyers to ensure a fair dealing for all parties
* Assist landlords in promoting their properties for sale, and offer advice to interested buyers
* Negotiate and prepare relevant paperwork (contracts, deeds, leases, etc.) prior to the sale of a commercial property
* Perform comparative market analysis to accurately value commercial properties
* Conduct research on the local market and stay up-to-date on industry trends

Skills and Qualifications

* A self-motivated and ambitious real estate professional
* Well-developed communication and relationship-building skills
* Excellent multitasker and enjoy working in a fast-paced environment
* A high level of personal responsibility, honesty, and empathy
* Goal-oriented with a focus on personal development
* Ability to bounce back from rejection, and solve problems creatively
* Good knowledge of the local property market

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $48,326.94 - $195,201.01 per year

Expected hours: 5 – 50 per week

Experience:

* Commercial Real Estate: 1 year (Preferred)

License/Certification:

* Real Estate License (Required)

title: Sales Associate
description:
Our Story
Madewell is a community-driven clothing destination that champions creativity, inclusivity, and self-expression. With denim at the brand’s core, Madewell also offers all the tenets of a great wardrobe, from easy tees and timeless outerwear to classic footwear and last-forever bags. Beyond impeccably designed products, Madewell also distinguishes itself through a number of meaningful sustainability initiatives, a best-in-class customer loyalty program, and community-driven initiatives including Hometown Heroes and Labels We Love. For more information, visit madewell.com and follow us @madewell.
Job Summary
As a Sales Associate, you act as a brand ambassador bringing your own personal style, passion for the product and welcoming energy to the sales floor each day. You’ll create genuine connections, helping customers to find their own unique look. You’ll collaborate with your team members and managers to drive the business, jump in on tasks that help create a seamless customer experience, and bring a collaborative, kind, and inclusive energy to the sales floor.
Job Responsibilities* Drive sales by exceeding selling and service expectations.
* Complete training, use product knowledge tools, participate in fit sessions and put those experiences to use.
* Assist in store tasks—our customers should always see us at our best.
* Share feedback, insights and ideas with the management team.
* Act in a manner that aligns with our values.


(About you) You’ll be great in the role if you …* Make the best first impression—smile, welcome and connect with customers authentically.
* Love the brand and have a great fashion aesthetic.
* Do what it takes to create seamless, amazing experiences customers can’t stop talking about.
* Bring your best to everything you do and achieve your goals.
* Are flexible, and ready to have fun along the way.
* Leverage technology, while also knowing that devices don’t dominate the dialogue.
* Build productive relationships with everyone on the team and always respect each other.
* Are at least 18 years old.
* Are available when we are busy, including: nights, weekends and holidays.
* Can bend, reach, stretch as well as lift, carry and move at least 40 pounds | 18 kilos.
* Can regularly move around all store areas and be accessible to customers.


Before we wrap, a word about a few of our way cool perks…* Competitive base pay and bonus programs
* Flexible days and hours
* Amazing merchandise discounts
* 24/7 free confidential help with a variety of personal and work concerns
* Personal and professional development
* Giving back –volunteer program, disaster relief funds, charitable matching donations\\*
* Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, pet insurance, legal plan, ID theft, commuter benefit\\*
* Time Away – paid time off, holidays, parental leave, disability leave, bereavement\\*
* 401(k) plan with company matching contributions

* Note: availability of these benefits and perks may be subject to work location & employment type and may have certain eligibility requirements.


Hourly Range: $16.00 - $22.75
At J.Crew Group (JCG) we aim to pay competitively for our company’s size and industry. The base salary offered will take into account internal equity and may vary depending on the candidate’s geographic region of work premises, job-related knowledge, skills, and experience among other factors. The base salary is just one component of J.Crew Group’s competitive total rewards strategy that also includes the opportunity for bonus, competitive benefits and perks.
One of our core focuses here at JCG is creating a community and culture that builds belonging. We are deeply committed to our Diversity, Equity and Inclusion efforts, and we warmly welcome job applicants of all backgrounds.  

JCG is proud to affirmatively provide equal opportunity to all associates and qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, national origin or citizenship, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, legally protected physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other basis protected under applicable law.

title: Food Inspector/Sampler
description:
**About us**

We are professional, engaging, supportive and our goal is to Provide First Class Services to the Food, Spice, Commodity, and Raw Good Industries.

Our work environment includes:

* Growth opportunities
* On-the-job training

AMERICAN SAMPLING Provides Inspection and Sample Collection services to the Food, Spice, Commodity, and Raw Good Industries. We are currently Looking to hire a new Sampler to add to the team.

**Job Position**: Sampler (Collect Samples of varies products to be sent for grading and or testing)

**Work Location(s)**:

* Eastampton NJ (Main Job Site/Warehouse) "Hiring mainly for this location" 90% of time working out of this location
* Edison Nj (Secondary Job Site)
* Additional Job Sites- occasionally we do work at other job sites and warehouses. Candidate must be willing to travel to different locations when needed (usually within an hour radius).

**Skills/Must Have(s)**

* Reliable (Show up on time and daily)
* Attention to Detail
* Strong Work Ethic
* Motivated
* Ability to bend and move freely
* Ability to Lift 50LBS (if Needed)
* Ability to work independently, managing your time and duties
* Reliable Transporation

Looking for a Motivated, Detail Oriented, Trustworthy, Hardworking individual who want to grow with the Company. No experience is necessary as training will be provided. This is not your typical job with a boss barking orders at you all day. We do expect work to be done however, once trained we put trust in our team to be able to manage themselves, there time and job respectively. As we like to encourage a strong work ethic we offer bonuses for work performance.

if you believe you are a good fit for this job please apply. applicants who are truly interested Are encouraged to send us a message with the application Explaining why you would be a good fit.

No, this is not a Food Tasting or Eating job

title: Medical Assistant -Spanish Speaking -Full Time-
description:
Job Title: Medical Office Assistant

Company: Sports Spine Care

Company Description:  
EUGENE LIU, MD  
Medical Director **Fellowship-Trained Spine Specialist**   
**Dr. Eugene Liu founded Restoration Sports & Spine Center with a unique combination of pain management as well as surgical and nonsurgical procedures to offer powerful results in one caring, convenient office.**

This position is very patient experience-oriented and requires that the individual possess excellent communication skills in English and Spanish in order to communicate pleasantly with patients. You must be confident and comfortable assisting the Doctors while they treat patients in the procedure rooms.

THE MEDICAL PRACTICE SUPPORTS MULTIPLE DOCTORS, SO WE ARE ONLY LOOKING FOR TEAM PLAYERS TO APPLY.

The candidate must have basic knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and have used medical software in the past. Must have great energy and a professional image. You should be passionate about dealing with people, and be a team player. The current team of 16 operates in a fast-paced environment and is excited to see the team grow as this growing practice continues to thrive.

Sports Spine Care offers a supportive work environment where teamwork and patient satisfaction are paramount. If you are passionate about healthcare and possess the required skills, we welcome you to apply for the Medical Office Assistant position. Join us in providing exceptional care under the guidance of Dr. Eugene Liu, a renowned Spine Specialist.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $18.00 - $21.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

title: Assistant Manager
description:
```Overview: We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced Assistant Manager to join our team. As an Assistant Manager, you will play a key role in supporting the overall operations and success of our business. This is a dynamic and fast-paced position that requires strong leadership skills, excellent communication abilities, and a passion for delivering exceptional customer service. Duties: - Assist the Manager in overseeing daily operations, including opening and closing procedures - Provide exceptional customer service by addressing customer inquiries, resolving issues, and ensuring customer satisfaction - Interview, hire, train, and develop team members to ensure they have the necessary skills to perform their roles effectively - Monitor and manage inventory levels to ensure product availability and minimize waste - Collaborate with the Manager to develop and implement sales strategies to achieve revenue targets - Assist in creating and executing marketing initiatives to promote products and increase brand awareness - Ensure compliance with company policies, procedures, and safety guidelines - Handle cash management responsibilities, including cash handling, deposits, and reconciliations Requirements: - Previous experience in a supervisory or leadership role preferred - Strong time management skills with the ability to prioritize tasks effectively - Proven track record in sales and achieving targets - Excellent team management abilities with the capacity to motivate and inspire others - Exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written - Ability to handle challenging situations with professionalism and tact - Proficient in training development to enhance team members' skills and knowledge - Demonstrated leadership qualities with the ability to make sound decisions If you are a dynamic individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and has a passion for delivering outstanding customer service, we would love to hear from you. Join our team as an Assistant Manager today!```
